required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acceptance of the CP950 Sound Processor
clinical_study.official_title: Acceptance of the CP950 Sound Processor With Experienced CP810/CP900 BTE Sound Processor Users

brief_summary.textblock: Acceptance of CP950 sound processor with experience CP810/CP900 BTE sound processor users.

detailed_description.textblock: Acceptance of the CP950 sound processor with experienced CP920/CP910 users.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Repeated measures, single-subject experiment. Each subject received the same treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Agreement on Satisfaction or personal applicability rating on statements with ratings from 1-5. 1= Disagree, to 5=Agree
primary_outcome.description: Baseline questionnaire completed at first visit, and CP950 questionnaire and CP950/Own processor questionnaire completed at final visit.
First take home diary issued at first visit and collected at Visit 2. Second diary issued at Visit 3 and collected at final visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage words correct out of a list of 50 words.
Speech reception thresholds level of 50% correct sentence identification from a list of 20 sentences.
secondary_outcome.description: BKB sentences presented with 4 Talker babble noise.

arm_group.description: CP950 Off The Ear (OTE) sound processor
Behind the Ear (BTE) sound processor (either a CP810 or CP900 series)

intervention.description: Off The Ear (OTE) Cochlear Implant Sound Processor
Behind The Ear (BTE) Cochlear Implant Sound Processor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Eighteen years of age or older
2. At least 6 months experience with a Nucleus 24 series or later implant in at least one implanted ear
3. At least 3 months experience with the CP810,CP920 or CP910 sound processor
4. Native speaker in the language used to assess speech perception performance
5. Willingness to participate in and to comply with all requirements of the protocol
6. Able to score 30% or more at +15 SNR with CI alone
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unrealistic expectations on the part of the subject, regarding the possible benefits, risks and limitations that are inherent to the procedure and prosthetic device
2. Additional disabilities that would prevent participation in evaluations
3. Nucleus 22 Implant
